General.text:
Type: Bradykinin receptor antagonist
Dosage Forms: 30mg
Routes of Administration: Subcutaneous
Common Trade Names: Firazyr

Hereditary_angioedema.text:
30mg subcutaneous x 1
May repeat q6h if inadequate response/symptoms recur
Max 90mg/24 hours

30mg subcutaneous x 1
May repeat q6h if inadequate response/symptoms recur
Max 90mg/24 hours

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: safety unknown
Renal Dosing
Hepatic Dosing

Serious.text:
Caution if acute MI
Caution if unstable angina
Caution if recent stroke

Common.text:
Injection site reaction
Dizziness
Fever
Increased LFTs

Serious.text:

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 1.4h
Metabolism: Proteolytic degradation
Excretion: Urine 10% unchanged
Mechanism of Action: selectively antagonizes bradykinin B2 receptor

Comments.text:
NEJM article 1/2015 randomized 27 people with ACEi induced angioedema to icatibant vs std therapy (Prednisone 500mg + Clemastine 2mg) looking at time to resolution.
RESULTS- significantly shorter (8 hrs vs 27.1 hrs) in icatibant group.
Cost according to Goodrx= $9,000/dose (on 8/7/2015)
